channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Personalized vaccine offers hope for patients with late-stage kidney cancer, clinical trial shows
item.description: Researchers, in a sense, manipulated each patient’s cancer in an attempt to prevent it from coming back.

item.title: Congressman sponsoring DeepSeek ban says China has ‘tried many, many’ times to infiltrate the U.S. via software. ‘We’re right to be vigilant’
item.description: A bipartisan initiative wants to ban DeepSeek on government devices over national security concerns.

item.title: Plane Crashes Into Street in Brazil, Killing 2
item.description: Six people on the ground were also injured by the plane, part of which struck a bus on the road when it crashed.

item.title: H-1B visa debates roil U.S.-India relations ahead of Trump-Modi meeting. Here’s what needs to change—on both sides
item.description: Can "Made in the USA" and "Make in India" coexist? Protectionist policies from each side are hindering progress.

item.title: Trump Lawsuits Against Media Gain Momentum
item.description: First Amendment experts say Mr. Trump’s lawsuits, based on an unproven legal theory, lack merit. But more could be on the way.

item.title: Plane Crashes Into Street in Brazil, Killing 2
item.description: Six people on the ground were also injured by the plane, part of which struck a bus on the road when it crashed.

item.title: A 311-Year-Old Stradivarius Violin Sells for $11.25 Million at Sotheby’s
item.description: The money from the sale of the violin, which was once owned by the 19th-century virtuoso Joseph Joachim, will benefit a scholarship program at the New...

item.title: Dozens of Clinical Trials Have Been Frozen in Response to Trump’s USAID Order
item.description: The stop-work order on U.S.A.I.D.-funded research has left thousands of people with experimental drugs and devices in their bodies, with no access to ...

item.title: How Emily Sundberg’s ‘Feed Me’ Newsletter Made Her Into a Rising Substack Star
item.description: Emily Sundberg’s business newsletter, Feed Me, has made her a rising Substack star.

item.title: Plane Crashes Into Street in Brazil Shortly After Takeoff
item.description: Two people were killed and six were injured by a plane crash in the middle of the street in São Paolo.

item.title: Stablecoin donation company Coala Pay closes $3.5 million funding round
item.description: Coala Pay connects donors with local aid organizations using smart contracts and stablecoins.

item.title: Senior public-health officials are reportedly being asked to rank thousands of employees on how vital they are to agency functions
item.description: The White House is preparing an executive order to slash thousands of workers from the HHS and CDC, according to anonymous employees.

item.title: Congo Buries Its Dead After Rebel Assault
item.description: A single image captures the grim task facing those who needed to find space for the dead after a spasm of violence in Central Africa.

item.title: Congo Buries Its Dead After Rebel Assault
item.description: A single image captures the grim task facing those who needed to find space for the dead after a spasm of violence in Central Africa.

item.title: Trump Envoy Pushes Lebanon’s New Leaders to Isolate Hezbollah
item.description: Hezbollah, a powerful Iran-backed militia, has long been the country’s dominant political force and has formed part of the government for decades.
